dmca.title: [EV1-C1857749I] Infringement re Emerald Passport Trade-marks
dmca.body:
t -----Original Message----- From: abuse@ev1.net [mailto:abuse@ev1.net] Posted At: Friday, November 17, 2006 5:43 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [EV1-C1857749I] Infringement re Emerald Passport Trade-marks Subject: [EV1-C1857749I] Infringement re Emerald Passport Trade-marks ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== 1. Infringement re Emerald Passport Trade-marks Added by system at Friday, Nov 17 2006 11:36 am X-MailFrom: trademarkcompliance@emeraldpassportinc.com X-RcptTo: abacus@abacus.ev1servers.net Received: from [70.87.6.111] by [216.12.192.78] (abacus) for ; Fri Nov 17 11:36:29 2006 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp02.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Fri, 17 Nov 2006 11:35:45 -0600 Return-path: Delivery-date: Fri, 17 Nov 2006 11:35:45 -0600 Received: from mx02.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.181] helo=mx02.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from trademarkcompliance@emeraldpassportinc.com) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1Gl7ct-0002ji-RK for abuse@theplanet.com; Fri, 17 Nov 2006 11:35:45 -0600 Received: from mail.3dcity.com ([64.15.147.209]) by mx02.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from trademarkcompliance@emeraldpassportinc.com) with esmtp (Exim) id 1Gl7cm-0004sA-Gu for abuse@theplanet.com; Fri, 17 Nov 2006 11:35:39 -0600 Received: from [72.51.25.230] by mail.3dcity.com with SMTP (EHLO emeraldpassport) (ArGoSoft Mail Server Pro for WinNT/2000/XP, Version 1.8 (1.8.8.7)); Fri, 17 Nov 2006 12:35:27 Message-ID: <30859077.1163784921481.JavaMail.SYSTEM@emeraldpassport> Date: Fri, 17 Nov 2006 12:35:21 -0500 (COT) From: trademarkcompliance@emeraldpassportinc.com To: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: Infringement re Emerald Passport Trade-marks Mime-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/related; boundary="----=_Part_1389_32178713.1163784921481" X-Mailer: ColdFusion MX Application Server X-ArGoMail-Authenticated: sendemail@3dcity.com X-OriginalArrivalTime: 17 Nov 2006 17:35:45.0796 (UTC) FILETIME=[D022A440:01C70A6E] (multipart/related) MIME element (text/html)

Attn: ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

Be advised that I, Pablo Justiniani, am authorized to act on behalf of Emerald Passport,Inc., the owner of the exclusive trademarks and copyrights that are referred to herein and am of a firm belief that use of the material in the manner complained of herein is not authorized by the copyright owner, nor its agent, nor the law.

Please be advised that the following correspondence was sent to your client Darling Enterprise, who has to date failed to comply with our request that the material they are using in violation of our trademark rights be removed. We are now requesting that you, as their hosting company please take whatever actions necessary to end this violation of our trademark rights.

While we understand that you are an unwitting accomplice in this gross, ongoing and financially damaging violation of our legal trademark rights we will be compelled by legal precedent to take legal action to halt any furtherance of this illegal activity, as well as to recover legal costs and monetary damages from both your client and yourself.

In protecting our legal rights, you are protecting your own, as well. Please act accordingly and with haste to end these gross infringements of our legal trademark protections.

Please reply favorably as to your actions to resolve this matter and we will update our legal department accordingly.


Pablo Justiniani
Asst. Compliance Manager
EPI Trademark Compliance


Dear ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.

Be advised that I, Pablo Justiniani, am authorized to act on behalf of Emerald Passport, Inc., the owner of the exclusive trademarks and copyrights that are referred to herein and am of a firm belief that use of the material in the manner complained of herein is not authorized by the copyright owner, nor its agent, nor the law.

As you may be legally complicit in this abuse of our trademark rights we are informing you that we have sent by electronic mail the attached demand to cease and desist from continuing these abuses to:

Darling Enterprise (abuse@theplanet.com)
2805 Ashwood Dr Columbia, MO 65203 US

Infringed copyright work: The trade-marks "EMERALD PASSPORT" and/or "EPI" as a sponsored link keyword or a meta-tag.

Material that is infringing: http://www.lifestylesmar ketinggroup.com/

Attachment(s) of the snap shot of the website:


Attn: Darling Enterprise

RE: Infringement re Emerald Passport Trade-marks

Be advised that I, Pablo Justiniani, am authorized to act on behalf of Emerald Passport,Inc., the owner of the exclusive trademarks and copyrights that are referred to herein and am of a firm belief that use of the material in the manner complained of herein is not authorized by the copyright owner, nor its agent, nor the law.

It has come to our attention that you have been using one or more of our trade-marks in the meta-tags of your website(s) and/or as a Sponsored Link in relation to your website(s) under Google's and/or Yahoo's advertising programs. We are providing you with this opportunity to voluntarily stop this practice immediately and thereby avert legal action.

By virtue of our wide-spread and continuous use of the trademarks "EMERALD PASSPORT" and "EPI" since 2002, we have established valuable proprietary rights. Based on those rights, we are entitled to prevent other businesses from adopting similar names that could mislead the public to confuse the businesses or to think that there is any connection between them.

The use of the trade-marks "EMERALD PASSPORT" and/or "EPI" as a sponsored link keyword or a meta-tag is also a violation of Google's and Yahoo's Trade-mark Policy. Specifically, under Google's AdWord's Terms and Conditions, a trade-mark may not be used as a keyword ad trigger or in the ad itself if its use constitutes trade-mark infringement, nor can any trade-mark be used in relation to any website that creates a negative connotation toward the trade-mark owner.

Further, your use of the trade-marks "EMERALD PASSPORT" or "EPI" is likely to cause confusion, a dilution of the distinctiveness of our trade-mark or may mistakenly make the public believe there is a connection, between our business and yours, and therefore amounts to the tort of passing off and a dilution of our trade-mark rights for which we would be entitled to injunctive relief restraining any further use by you of our trade-marks, as well as monetary recovery for damages, and legal costs.

We insist that you immediately cease and desist from any further use of any Sponsored Links keyword or meta-tags that includes the trade-marks "EMERALD PASSPORT" and/or "EPI" or any confusingly similar variations thereof.

In the absence of a satisfactory response from you within 48 hours of the date of this notice, we will assume that you are not prepared to cooperate with our request and will proceed accordingly to vigorously protect our valuable trade-mark rights.

There will be no further notice prior to commencing legal action against you. Govern yourself accordingly.


Pablo Justiniani
Asst. Compliance Manager
EPI Trademark Compliance
